source.description: Using the pre-coated PLO-laminin plate, aspirate laminin from 2-3 wells. Remove supernatant from 15 mL conical tube containing 2 wells of neural rosette clusters. See protocol below.

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"dkdoi","text":"On Day 5 of neural aggregate formation, remove media (by pipetting) and carefully wash spheres with  of pre-warmed DMEM\/F12. Repeat 2 times. This approach will transfer more dead cells into the new well. {"blocks":[{"key":"6jlf1","text":"Aspirate laminin from one well of the pre-coated plate. Using 200 \u03bcl sterile tips, carefully pipet up spheres from wells using  volume and transfer thirty-two spheres per well. Repeat above steps for the remaining wells. Incubate cells in  , 5% CO2 and 95% humidified chamber and distribute evenly by making a \u201cT\u201d motion. {"blocks":[{"key":"eipdf","text":"Monitor spheres daily under microscope for formation of neural rosette structures. Neural rosettes are ready to harvest when spheres have completely flattened and clusters are clearly visible (3-7 days after plating, line dependent). Add  of pre-warmed DMEM\/F12 to each well to remove unattached cells (repeat if necessary).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":56,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"265CD0A032E411E9AC957DCD0629DAD2","amount":"1","unit":2,"label":"","step_guid":"19994C4032E411E9AC957DCD0629DAD2"}}],"guid":"19994C4032E411E9AC957DCD0629DAD2","id":709581,"previous_id":709580,"previous_guid":"0E0B3AA032E411E9AC957DCD0629DAD2","section":null}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79obm","text":"Add   of Neural Rosette Selection reagent to each well and incubate for up to   at  (check cells at  . Cells are typically collected after 30-45 min incubation. Look for rosette structure to be rounding up without the disturbance of other surrounding cells). {"blocks":[{"key":"9g1qo","text":"Carefully remove Neural Rosette Selection reagent with a pipet, being careful not to disturb rosette clusters. Add   DMEM\/F12 to each well, then using a p1000 detach rosette clusters by  rinsing over them. {"blocks":[{"key":"7e4qt","text":"Transfer rosette material from 1 well into a 15 mL conical tube for cryopreservation of neural rosettes and from 2 wells into a separate 15 mL conical tube for neural progenitor expansion. Do not triturate clusters. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b8o5t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"f7e9l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"2jfr0","text":"To maintain a pure culture, it is best to leave some rosettes behind rather than collect all of the rosettes and additional cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"5663959032E411E9AC957DCD0629DAD2","id":709584,"previous_id":709583,"previous_guid":"4167933032E411E9AC957DCD0629DAD2","section":null}

source.description:
Add appropriate amount of neural induction media (NIM) to achieve a final volume of
per well. Pipet clusters up and down breaking them into 1/4 or 1/5 the size of the rosette cluster.

Add
of neural rosette cluster suspension to each well and incubate at
, 5% CO2 and 95% humidified chamber for
.

Examine adherent cells under microscope, aspirate off medium and replace with
of fresh neural induction medium daily for 3-5 days or until they reach ~80% confluent.

Make
of DMEM/F12 supplemented with 10% FBS by adding
of FBS to
of DMEM/F12 to inhibit trypsin activity (termed “Complete Media”).
Remove medium and rinse cells with 1 mL/well of DMEM/F12 .

Harvest cells by adding 1 mL/well of 0.05% trypsin and incubate at
for
.

Inhibit trypsin activity by adding
of DMEM/F12 supplemented with 10% FBS to each well.

Collect cells in 15mL conical tube. Centrifuge at 750 rpm for
.

source.body: To minimize bubbles and increase cell yield, add 1mL Complete Media to 15mL conical tube. After trypsinization, add 3mL DMEM/F12 to collect cells and transfer to 15mL conical tube.

source.description:
Aspirate supernatant and resuspend in
of NIM, pipet at least 3 times to break up large clumps.

source.body: Small clumps and single cells are acceptable to passage.

source.description: Passage cells to pre-coated PLO-lamin plates (see above) by adding 2 mLs/well of suspended cells for a total of 6 wells.

Feed with
of fresh NIM daily until they reach 85-95% confluency.

IMPORTANT: NPCs are best maintained by passaging at a 1:3 dilution. Passaging cells that are more dilute will result in slow growth. Cells will typically become confluent after 2-4 days when plated as a 1:3 dilution. If NPCs are observed to slow in their growth, passage cells and replate without dilution.
